instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed â€“ if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.HALL_SENSOR_RIGHT: What is HALL_SENSOR_RIGHT? HALL_SENSOR_RIGHT is a signal from the hall sensor on the RIGHT side of the machine that indicates that the lid has been closed. This is necessary for setting SMC_LID properly so the machine knows whether it is closed or open. When this is low, the machine will think it is closed which may cause it to go to sleep or have no backlight on the screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
hi, this board came in with a bit of liquid damage at ub400 and ub300, both of these corresponding port will stay on,   while the other two looping.
i replaced both ub400 and ub300, and i got 20v on all port now.
i tested it in chassis and it did boot.
i leave it one day, and next day it doesnt turn on anymore.

when i plug usb c charger, it will go 20v, current fluctuating like its booting, and i did get usb activity for a few second, and then it will stuck at 0.08, no more usb activity.
all port behave the same. any clue what to go for ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Something else corroded on the board, or accessories.
Some I/V sensor may be triggered.
Can you turn it on in SMC bypass mode?

Also test the board alone, disconnecting anything; keep only charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
smc bypass always boot fine.
anyway, the problem was <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL>.
i replace the 3 leg ic at J5260 that doesnt produce <SIGNAL>HALL_SENSOR_RIGHT</SIGNAL>, and mac boot up fine now.
i thought <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> missing only dim the display but still produce usb activity ? ( this is solved, but just curious.. )

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
You should noted that all MacBooks boot up even with lid closed; you can hear the chime, when available.
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> controls image/backlight and trackpad/keyboard activity.

On Windows side, laptops don't turn on at all, if lid is closed.
